data.title: Casual End of Summer Lunch
data.text: Stopped in after a morning of shopping around town. Arrived after the usual lunch rush and sat in a booth. Service is always friendly and fast, hence the name Dash In.  We ordered Chicken Salad sandwich and the Mediterranean Veggie and they were delicious.  The grilled cheese and tomato soup is killer!  Must be over 21 to enter which is only drawback....I would easily bring teenage daughter to eat but oh well...

data.title: Save your money
data.text: Was invited to eat downtown at this restaurant last night.  It was located in one of the old buildings.  The menu I found was very limited but was encouraged to order a Pulled Pork Sandwich.  The sandwich was nothing more than some sort of BBQ spread from a Kroger store------not even close to Pulled Pork.  With a handful of chips and a coke it came to $15 !!!!  My wife had a large grilled cheese sandwich which was also recommended but it was $10.99 so again not really worth the cost.  Total  bill was $27.27.  Could have gone to Golden Coral for that.  Would not recommend and there was no convenient parking either.

data.title: Great Gem
data.text: I went to here with my sister and her husband and what a cute little gem. They have an amazing beer selection and just OK wine list. We had the portobello quesadilla the burger and a grilled cheese with vegetables I have to say the food was really good you can sit outside or inside. I can't remember the name of the waiter but it was his first day by himself and he did a fantastic job I definitely would come back here again.

data.title: Excellent grilled cheese
data.text: Came for dinner and beers and was not disappointed. Had the Gourmet Grilled Cheese with the tomato soup and it was delicious. Good selection of beers as well. Service was very good.

data.title: Good food, ok service, could use a good cleaning
data.text:
Stopped by the Dash-In the other night while on a date with my wife.  It took over 20 minutes to get the one item we were split (Sundried Tomato Bruschetta). While the tomatoes weren't sundried, the food was super yummy.  The wait was frustrating, because no one else ordered food before us.  It had been a number of years since we'd been to the Dash-in.  We were surprised at how dirty it was.  The window seat where we sat had  years and years of dirt and cobwebs.  The signs on the wall had thick layers of visible dust.  
Drink selection is large and the prices are reasonable.  Want to go back after we've heard they have spent some money on cleaning.  If the eating area is dirty, I am concerned about what is going on in the food prep area.

data.title: Tasty but dirty
data.text: We went in for appetizers and the food was delicious.  I would recommend the bruschetta - very flavorful.  We sat near the front window and were pretty appalled at how dirty the place was.  There were tons of bugs and dirt on the window sills and it was apparent that Dash In needs a good thorough cleaning.  I just hoped that the kitchen was more sanitary than the front end. We went in a little earlier than dinner time and the restaurant was almost empty. Service was very slow, which was ok since we weren't in a hurry.  It took about a half an hour to get appetizers.  Also, they are featuring adult themed art (it is an over 21 establishment), but we wouldn't choose to be exposed to that.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: I stopped in here because they had breakfast until 11am, glad I did.  Breakfast burrito was super delicious!  Coffee was great, I got a red eye.  I sit at the bar, and received wonderful friendly service.  I will definitely return for a cold beverage some evening, because it was a cool little bar that looks as if it draws good patrons!

data.title: Unique, hip, delicious
data.text: Knowledgeable, accommodating staff. Re-Inventive mouth watering menu that requires pouring over. Beer list that will require many visits. Seem to be lots of regulars here- with good cause.

data.title: Cute little pub restaurant
data.text: You cannot go wrong with the cute little place.  It has a small bar (beer and wine only) and lots of booths in an old brick building.  Atmosphere is great and Food is awesome.   Their grilled cheese is no ordinary sandwich, you will love it.

data.title: Great Stop for Breakfast or Lunch
data.text: Great breakfast and lunch restaurant/pub in downtown Fort Wayne. Becomes more of a bar in the afternoon/evening with large selection of craft beers.  Not kid-friendly; must be 21 to enter at all times.

data.title: Good food, Fun atmosphere
data.text: I went to the Dash-in after work with friends on a tap take over night.  The beer selection was very good.  The food was also very good, and the atmosphere and nice location downtown round out the place nicely to make it a place I'll make repeat visits.  The staff were friendly and welcoming and the others patrons were as laid back and fun as I could hope for!

data.title: Celebratory Dinner
data.text:
We had the pulled pork. Humus platter , raspberry latte  food was very good.   
Bar atmosphere price reasonable !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

data.title: Good Lunch, So-So Service
data.text: My beef and cheese sandwich was outstanding and cheap - $7 with a cup of soup.  Had to work to hard to get a refill on my ice tea, but it was under $2.

data.title: Very average
data.text: The good: large selection of draft and bottled beer.  Sandwiches were good, although not inexpensive.  Bar atmosphere - old and somewhat shabby.  Service subpar: waiter forgot to bring salad, never checked back with us, slow with check.  Overall, not bad but nothing special for dinner.  If you are trapped downtown for lunch, could do worse.

data.title: Get there early for lunch!
data.text: The Dash is awesome - food is great, cool atmosphere.  But you better get there early for lunch because it fills up fast every day!

data.title: Perfect Beer Selection
data.text: The Dash-In is a solid place to grab a nice bite to eat, and an even better place to post up next to the bar in search for some tasty craft beer while making new friends.  The food is above average while still low in cost.  The beer selection on draft is exceptional considering how small and cozy the dash is.  The atmosphere allows a great opportunity to strike up conversation with others while enjoying the finest of libations offered here.  Definitely my favorite place to visit when stopping through Fort Wayne.

data.title: Downtown lunch
data.text: Lunch time for the grilled cheese and tomato soup can get crowded during the work week but gourmet grilled cheese is worth it. Food is good but service can be slow.

data.title: Dash in today
data.text:
We dashed in between a wedding and the late reception based upon reviews from this site .

The food did not disappoint. We both had salads with premium greens and delicious dressings. The Asian vinaigrette was quite amazing. I had a hard time turning down the ahi. Definitely a good reason to come back.

All selections based on fresh mostly whole foods with a fine gluten free selection.

Place is rustic and lighting not so good. Would have great atmosphere if filled with people.

Service was really slow but I'll give it a slide as it was a slow hour between lunch and dinner. Server was not very attentive.

If lived here this would be a place I'd frequent often. A must visit.

data.title: I go for the beer, even in the breakfast hours.
data.text: The beer and coffee varieties and the availability to get both during breakfast is what makes this place worth going to for me. It's not close to where I live, so I have to already be downtown for something else to make this place an option for dining. There's nothing on the menu that continues to bring me back, but everything that I've had has been good. The service is up to par, but the wait staff isn't overly friendly to non-regulars.

data.title: "Over 21 only"
data.text: First restaurant I can ever remember being to that was only 21 and over. Even if the idea makes a lot of sense to me
